org.finra.herd.dao.helper

Class HerdCharacterEscapeHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.finra.herd.dao.helper.HerdCharacterEscapeHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.persistence.internal.oxm.CharacterEscapeHandler

    @Component
public class HerdCharacterEscapeHandler
extends Object
implements org.eclipse.persistence.oxm.CharacterEscapeHandler
    A custom escape handler that escapes XML 1.1 restricted characters (http://www.w3.org/TR/xml11/#charsets).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      HerdCharacterEscapeHandler()

    • Constructor Detail

      • HerdCharacterEscapeHandler

        public HerdCharacterEscapeHandler()

    • Method Detail

      • escape

        public void escape(char[] buffer,
                   int start,
                   int length,
                   boolean isAttributeValue,
                   Writer outputWriter)
            throws IOException
        Escape restricted XML 1.1 characters inside the buffer and send the output to the Writer. The "&", "<", and ">" characters are always escaped. Single and double quotes are escaped when within an attribute. All XML 1.1 restricted characters are escaped using "&#x(value);".
        Specified by:
        escape in interface org.eclipse.persistence.internal.oxm.CharacterEscapeHandler
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer.
        start - the start of the buffer.
        length - the length of the buffer.
        isAttributeValue - Flag that determines whether the buffer is an XML attribute or not.
        outputWriter - the output writer.
        Throws:
        IOException - which will stop the marshalling process.

      • isXml11RestrictedCharacter

        public static boolean isXml11RestrictedCharacter(char ch)
        Returns whether the specified character is XML 1.1 restricted.
        Parameters:
        ch - the character to check.
        Returns:
        True if the character is restricted or false if not.
